alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:20PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hot Springs County through 245 PM MDT... At 220 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Thermopolis, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thermopolis and Hot Springs State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin
